text: Neot Mordechai () is a kibbutz in northern Israel. Located in the Upper Galilee, it falls under the jurisdiction of Upper Galilee Regional Council. In it had a population of . ==History== The kibbutz was established on 2 November 1946 by Jewish immigrants from Czechoslovakia, Germany and Austria. It was named in honour of Mordechai Rozovsky, a Zionist activist in Argentina. File:נאות מרדכי - בערב העליה לנאות מרדכי, בנין גשר ארעי מעל הירדן- JNF034237.jpeg|Neot Mordechai building access bridge across Jordan River 1946 File:נאות מרדכי - מראה נאות מרדכי מפאת מערבי צפוני-JNF034246.jpeg|Neot Mordechai 1947 File:נאות מרדכי - אסיפת חברי נאות מרדכי בהשתתפות חלוצי ארגנטינה.-JNF045237.jpeg|Neot Mordechai members 1947 File:נאות מרדכי - משתלה.-JNF045236.jpeg|Neot Mordechai 1947 ==Economy== Aside from agriculture, the kibbutz is the home of Teva Naot, which is a shoe factory with many branches all over Israel and some selling overseas. ==References== ==External links== *Official website *Teva Sport Sandals Category:Kibbutzim Category:Kibbutz Movement Category:Populated places established in 1946 Category:Populated places in Northern District (Israel) Category:1946 establishments in Mandatory Palestine Category:Austrian-Jewish culture in Israel Category:Czech-Jewish culture in Israel Category:German-Jewish culture in Israel Category:Slovak-Jewish culture in Israel
title: Neot Mordechai
